results.name: Decimal expansion of smallest univoque Pisot Number.
link: J.-P. Allouche, C. Frougny, K. G. Hare, On univoque Pisot numbers, arXiv:math/0610681 [math.NT], (23-October-2006)
J.-P. Allouche, C. Frougny, K. G. Hare, On univoque Pisot numbers, Math. Comp. 76 (2007), 1639-1660.
D. Terr and Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pisot Numbers.
formula: The largest real root of x^14 - 2*x^13 + x^11 - x^10 - x^7 + x^6 - x^4 + x^3 - x + 1. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 17 2007 (corrected, _Joerg Arndt_, Jun 13 2015)
mathematica: First@ RealDigits[ FindRoot[ x^14 - 2 x^13 + x^11 - x^10 - x^7 + x^6 - x^4 + x^3 - x + 1, {x, 1.88}, WorkingPrecision -> 111][[1, 2]]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 17 2007 *)
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 13 2007
